intro: Talipariti hastatum, commonly known as the broadleaf soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are similar in appearance to the soursop but have a different flavor profile. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its fruit and ornamental value. Talipariti hastatum is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
